title: Emilia Clarke looks effortlessly stylish as she continues to promote Last Christmas in NYC
text:
She has been busy promoting her latest film, Last Christmas, across the globe ahead of its November release.

And Emilia Clarke looked effortlessly stylish as she stepped out in SoHo in New York City on Wednesday after appearing on Good Morning America.

The Game Of Thrones star, 33, appeared to go braless as she wore a plunging pinstriped trouser suit for her outing in the Big Apple.

Chic: Emilia Clarke looked effortlessly stylish as she stepped out in SoHo in New York City on Wednesday after appearing on Good Morning America

Dressing for the cool autumnal weather, Emilia layered her look with an oversized tailored camel coat.

The actress accessorised her ensemble with a pair of white heels, pendant earrings and brown tortoise shell sunglasses.

Emilia styled her brunette locks into a textured blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up to enhance her stunning features.

The Game Of Thrones star appeared in good spirits as she stepped out in NYC and beamed to photographers.

Stylish: The Game Of Thrones star, 33, appeared to go braless as she wore a plunging pinstriped trouser suit for her outing in the Big Apple

Keeping warm: Dressing for the cool autumnal weather, Emilia layered her look with an oversized tailored camel coat

Speaking to Stella magazine earlier this year, Emilia, who has suffered two brain aneurysms, said she resonated with her character Kate in the film, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness.

'It was uncanny reading the script because it’s my life at this point,' she said.

'I have the benefit of having space between myself and my sickness and what you see through Kate is the fear of what happens when your body fails you in some way.'

In the film, written by Emma Thompson, Emilia's character Kate finds work as Santa's elf for a department store and unexpectedly finds love with Tom, played by Henry Golding.

Glamorous: Emilia styled her brunette locks into a textured blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up to enhance her stunning features

Happy: The Game Of Thrones star appeared in good spirits as she stepped out in NYC and beamed to photographers

Candid: Speaking to Stella magazine earlier this year, Emilia, who has suffered two brain aneurysms, said she resonated with her character Kate in the film, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness

It comes after the star discussed her recovery from the life-threatening aneurysm she first suffered in 2011, when she was just 24-years-old.

Appearing on CBS Sunday Morning in April where she recalled the dark place she went to after her surgery, she shared images from her hospital stay, revealing the second aneurysm very nearly killed her.

Discussing the impact it had not just on her physical health but mental wellbeing, she revealed: 'The first time it was difficult, with the second one I found it much harder to stay optimistic.

Love is in the air: In the film, Emilia's character Kate finds work as Santa's elf for a department store and unexpectedly finds love with Tom, played by Henry Golding

'[I coped with it as a] a day to day thing. I definitely went through a period of being... down - putting it mildly.'

Emilia explained that when a part of your brain is starved of blood for more than a minute it dies, which is what happened to her after her second aneurysm.

Last Christmas hits cinemas November 7 in the UK, and November 8 in the USA.
